body:
IMO this doesn't make much semantic sense. Extract means to "remove or take out". Adding a "safe" version of Hash#extract would be like adding a "safe" version of Array#delete.

If anything, Hash#extract! should have been Hash#extract in the first place. Different people have said different things about the bang vs non-bang semantics, but my favourite version (I think it's from the Eloquent Ruby book) is that bang methods are reserved for a "dangerous" (use with caution) version of their non-bang counterpart, like AR#save vs AR#save!. Just because a method does in-place modification doesn't make it bang-worthy - Array#delete, Array#pop etc are all good examples.
